entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 9:46AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Frost Possible Tonight... Frost is possible tonight across the Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks. Clear skies this evening will allow temperatures to fall rapidly after sunset, with temperature dropping into the 30s after midnight. Frost will be most likely in low lying areas. Clouds moving north over the area on Thursday morning will cause

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 1:06PM MST until September 13 at 3:15PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MST/415 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 103 PM MST /203 PM MDT/, At 103 PM MST /203 PM MDT doppler radar indicated only light showers across the warned area. Thunderstorms earlier produced between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 12:57PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS GILA COUNTY... At 1256 PM MST, radar indicated strong thunderstorms were located near San Carlos, or 12 miles east of Globe, moving east at 40 mph. Conditions are becoming more favorable for the development of additional thunderstorms. Some storms may become strong to severe. Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail will be possible.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Globe, Miami; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County

entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Strong rip currents and elevated surf. Surf will be 3- 5 feet, with sets to 6 feet. Highest surf will be in northern Orange County. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:14AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of expected air and dewpoint temperatures will result in maximum Heat Index values between 105 and 109 degrees inclusive today. In addition, Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat.

entry.title: Frost Advisory issued September 13 at 2:22PM CDT until September 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 33 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Lincoln, Oneida, Vilas, and Forest Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost could harm sensitive outdoor vegetation. Sensitive outdoor plants may be killed if left uncovered.
